newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Lemarne says expects sound second half.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Lemarne says expects sound second half.

text.p: Industrial services group Lemarne Corp Ltd said on Thursday it expected a sound second half from each of its three operating units.
Lemarne earlier reported a 66 percent rise in net profit for the six months to December 31, 1996 to A$3.09 million from A$1.87 million for the previous corresponding period.
Chairman Brian Noxon said reinforced plastics unit Pacific Composites lifted sales by 10 percent to A$14.5 million, while Spectra Lighting lifted sales 28 percent to A$7.2 million.
Lemarne-controlled Lemvest Ltd boosted sales 64 percent to A$44.8 million, and lifted net profit to A$2.56 million from A1.78 million previously.
Noxon said directors were cautiously optimistic an improving trend at Lemvest's metal products unit Richardson Pacific would continue, while further growth was expected at electronics unit Com 10.
"Directors believe the second half (for Lemvest) should also be satisfactory and that prospects for 1997/98 look most encouraging," Noxon said.
